title.value: Common Challenges of Deep Reinforcement Learning Applications Development: An Empirical Study
title.justification: The title of the paper is clearly stated at the beginning.
title.quote: Common Challenges of Deep Reinforcement Learning Applications Development: An Empirical Study

extractions.description: This paper conducts a large-scale empirical study of 927 Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL)-related posts extracted from Stack Overflow. It categorizes these posts to develop a taxonomy of common challenges encountered in the development of DRL applications, which is validated through a survey with DRL developers.

type.justification: The paper involves the collection and analysis of data from Stack Overflow posts and a validation survey to categorize and understand common challenges in DRL.
type.quote: To fill this gap, in this paper, we conduct a large-scale empirical study of 927 DRL-related posts extracted from Stack Overflow.

name.justification: The study focuses on challenges specific to the development of DRL applications.
name.quote: Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) is a subdomain of ML used to produce intelligent agents.

name.justification: Machine Learning is the overarching field that includes Deep Reinforcement Learning as a subdomain.
name.quote: Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) is a subdomain of ML used to produce intelligent agents.

name.justification: TensorFlow is frequently mentioned as a library used in DRL application development.
name.quote: Regarding parallelization and multi-threading, as can be seen in Fig. 7d, the majority of issues are reported against TensorFlow.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not refer to a specific title for TensorFlow's library.

name.justification: Keras is noted as a widely used library alongside TensorFlow and PyTorch in the development of DRL applications.
name.quote: TensorFlow, Keras, and PyTorch are the most popular libraries/frameworks.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not refer to a specific title for Keras' library.

name.justification: PyTorch is identified as a frequently referenced library in the paper for implementing DRL applications.
name.quote: TensorFlow, Keras, and PyTorch are frequently mentioned in posts.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not refer to a specific title for PyTorch's library.

name.justification: OpenAI Gym is highlighted as the most popular library for implementing RL/DRL environments.
name.quote: About the most frequently referenced libraries/frameworks in the DRL libraries/frameworks category, as illustrated in Fig.7c, gym received the largest number of questions.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not refer to a specific title for OpenAI Gym's library.

name.justification: RLlib is indicated as a library often mentioned in the context of DRL development, particularly for distributed processing.
name.quote: It can be related to the fact that Ray encompasses not only DRL-related libraries (e.g., RLlib) but also various other libraries for a wide range of ML-related tasks.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not refer to a specific title for RLlib's library.

name.justification: Apart from RLlib, Ray is recognized for supporting multiprocessing and other ML tasks, making it a crucial library in the DRL development space.
name.quote: Ray is the most challenging library when dealing with multi-processing and data preprocessing operations.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not refer to a specific title for Ray's library.
